Question
========

Which of the following statements about Diebold-Mariano-test ARE correct? 		
		
Answerlist
----------

*  Diebold-Mariano-test can be used to compare 3 or more forecasts to each other
*  Diebold-Mariano-test can be used to compare short and long-term forecasts
*  Diebold-Mariano-test is based on the idea of testing that the square loss by model A equals to the square loss by model B
*  If model A has smaller RMSE than a naive model then model A should always be preferred  


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

*  False. DM-test is not suitable for pairwise comparison of multiple forecasts
*  True. 
*  True.
*  False. The simpler the better, if by Diebold-Mariano-test the forecasts aren't different, probably a naive model can be preferred
